# isCinematicVideoCaptureSupported

**Instance Property**

A BOOL value specifying whether Cinematic Video capture is supported.

## Declaration

```swift
var isCinematicVideoCaptureSupported: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

With Cinematic Video capture, you get a simulated depth-of-field effect that keeps your subjects (people, pets, and more) in sharp focus while applying a pleasing blur to the background (or foreground). Depending on the focus mode (see [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/CinematicVideoFocusMode] for detail), the camera either uses machine learning to automatically detect and focus on subjects in the scene, or it fixes focus on a subject until it exits the scene. Cinematic Videos can be played back and edited using the Cinematic framework.

You can adjust the video’s simulated aperture before starting a recording using the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDeviceInput/simulatedAperture] property. With Cinematic Video specific focus methods on [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice], you can dynamically control focus transitions.

Movie files captured with Cinematic Video enabled can be played back and edited with the [Cinematic framework] (https://developer.apple.com/documentation/cinematic/playing-and-editing-cinematic-mode-video?language=objc).

This property returns `true` if the session’s current configuration allows Cinematic Video capture. When switching cameras or formats, this property may change. When this property changes from `true` to `false`, [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDeviceInput/isCinematicVideoCaptureEnabled] also reverts to `false`. If you’ve previously opted in for Cinematic Video capture and then change configuration, you may need to set [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDeviceInput/isCinematicVideoCaptureEnabled] to `true` again. This property is key-value observable.



## Configuring Cinematic video capture

- **isCinematicVideoCaptureEnabled**: A BOOL value specifying whether the Cinematic Video effect is being applied to any movie file output, video data output, metadata output, or video preview layer added to the capture session.
- **simulatedAperture**: Shallow depth of field simulated aperture.
